Question: Mark told John "If you give me half your money I will have Rs.75. John said, "if you give me one third of your money, I will have Rs.75/-. How much money did John have ?
Choices:
  A: 22
  B: 60
  C: 28
  D: 26
  E: 18
Reflection:

Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Instructions:

Thought: I previously answered this question incorrectly, and I understand that John had Rs.75.

Reflection: I analyzed my previous solution and realized that I made a mistake in calculating the amount of money John had. I misunderstood the problem and gave the wrong answer.

Action: I will now use my self-reflection to answer the question correctly.

Answer: The correct answer is (C) 28.

Explanation: John had Rs.75, and if he gives half of it to Mark, John will have Rs.75/2 = Rs.37.50. If John gives one-third of his money to Mark, John will have Rs.75/3 = Rs.25. So, John had Rs.37.50 + Rs.25 = Rs.62.50.
